titleInfo.title: Auguste Doussan Son Compte Courant avec A.J. Doussan, 1845 May 13

mods.abstract: Auguste Doussan was the younger brother of Antoine Doussan. He practiced medicine in Grasse, France, and married Louise Perrin, who was a relative of the Allain family of Louisiana.This letter contains financial statements for Auguste Doussan between May 1844 and May 1845.
mods.note: Baton Rouge, May 13, 1845, 'Auguste Doussan Son Compte Courant avec A.J. Doussan.' Statements for May 1844-May 1845.
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Division, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Doussan Family Papers, Mss. 4800, Louisiana and Lower Mississippi Valley Collections, LSU Libraries, Baton Rouge, Louisiana.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
